page.title: 16ECOLOGY - Wild life
page.content: Wild animals to be seen in the area include hares, rabbits, badgers, foxes and deer. Hares usually spend the day alone, lying in a hollow on the ground. After sunset they come out to feed. Rabbits spend most of the day in their burrows, coming out to feed in the late afternoon. Badgers come out in the dark. Foxes are quite common in the area and they help to reduce the rabbit population.Deer are not usually found in the area but they can be seen now and again. They come out from the woods to the north of Brierton. Many people go hunting. Sometimes the hunting is legal but some hunters go on land without permission or hunt animals which are protected by law. Terriers and lurcher dogs, ferrets and polecats are used. Equipment includes nets, snares and guns.
